intro: Lijndenia udzungwarum, commonly known as the Udzungwa liana, is a woody climbing plant native to the forests of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, twisting stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round berries that are edible. Lijndenia udzungwarum plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
